title: Co-op forced to HIDE steak from customers - because they keep stealing it
text:
The supermarket has been forced to hide its steak from customers (Photo: SWNS) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
A city centre supermarket is HIDING expensive steak from customers in a bid to thwart shoplifters . 
A sign on the empty shelf blamed 'deviants' who keep stealing the choice meat from the busy Co-op branch. 
Fed-up staff said the meat was being stolen almost daily with thieves brazenly walking in and grabbing it without paying. 
They said on some occasions they were taking so much there was little left for genuine customers. Read More Man caught on CCTV 'stealing' £115 tree from outside florist Meat theft is a problem at the store (Photo: SWNS) 
One frustrated worker said they often chased thieves out of the store in Plymouth, Devon to demand payment or the return of the steak. 
And they claimed local police had been alerted - but refuse to investigate such small value thefts. 
Large signs blaming 'deviants' were initially placed on a glass cabinet door and by the cashiers. 
They have since been removed and replaced with a smaller and more tactfully-worded notice. Signs have been removed and replaced with a smaller and more tactfully-worded notice (Photo: SWNS) 
It reads: "Due to the high level of shoplifting on steak please ask a member of staff if you require this product. 
"We apologise for any inconvenience this causes our honest customers." 
The local neighbourhood police team said officers prioritise "repeat and prolific" offenders and rely on information from stores. 
But they also questioned what security efforts were being made by stores who suffer from shoplifting thefts, such as security staff and the location of high-value items.
